subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The rookie Devin Setoguchi and Patrick Marleau connected in the shootout after scoring regulation goals, and the San Jose Sharks beat host Dallas, 4-3, in the Stars’ first game since a major front office shake-up.Tom Hicks, the Stars’ owner, made several management changes Tuesday and yesterday, hoping to jump-start his struggling team. Dallas rallied from a two-goal third-period deficit to send the game into overtime before losing its fourth in a row at home.Hicks fired General Manager Doug Armstrong on Tuesday, replacing him with the former star Brett Hull and the assistant general manager Les Jackson as co-interim general managers. Hicks moved Jim Lites, the team president, into a full-time role in his sports marketing firm yesterday, giving the team president’s job to Jeff Cogen, who had filled the same position for Hicks’s baseball franchise, the Texas Rangers.
